docs.text: Hub and Spoke with Terraform ¶ Overview ¶ A hub and spoke topology is a way to isolate workloads while sharing common services. These services include identity and security. The hub is a virtual network (VNet) that acts as a central connection point to an on-premises network. The spokes are VNets that peer with the hub. Shared services are deployed in the hub, while individual workloads are deployed inside spoke networks. This repo contain the necessary scripts to build out an Azure platform using a hub and spoke model. The hub folder contain the terraform files to build vnets on-premise vnet to simulate an on premise datacenter hub vnet spoke1 vnet spoke2 vnet The webapp1_spoke folder contain webapp1 spoke 2 web server that is part of a vmscale set instructions ¶ from Azure Cloud Shell terraform init terraform plan terraform apply more info ¶ Based on the following Microsoft tutorial on build hub and spoke vnets https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/terraform/terraform-hub-spoke-introduction
